text: Melee attack: %+n for Larenscheld's ghost form
Melee defence: %+n for Larenscheld's ghost form

Ward save: %n% for Larenscheld's ghost form
Bonus vs Large: %+n for Larenscheld's ghost form
Weapon strength: %+n% for Larenscheld's ghost form
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Bone steeds pull dreaded chariots, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Once the Dread Legion had soldiers beyond counting. Now they lay beneath the sand, until their master calls them to battle once more.
The legion ever marches onwards to bring death to the living.
Neither grievous wounds nor death can hold down the favoured servants of Nagash for long.
The Dread King marches at the front of his legions to further the plans of his master, Nagash, and bring the blessing of death to the living.
Focussing the winds of death around him, the Hand of Nagash can unleash a devastating wave of destruction.
The Hand of Nagash was known to terrorize the lands on his mighty chariot, filled with dark magic.
The skeleton on this weapon is known to scream in agony. No sound is produced, yet all close to it feel its pain and witness its torment.
A gift from Nagash to a loyal servant, the hungering blade will extend the unholy existence of its wielder should he ever be in danger.
To be honest it is mostly executioner. Everyone who stands against Nagash is guilty by default.
Where the Hand of Nagash goes, fear and despair follow.
The Hand of Nagash has always been infamous for their merciless use of chariots and riders.
No land is too remote, no place is truly ever out of reach.
Magic made the Hand what he is now, but in war he prefers cold steel over the might of magic.
Burn the cities of the living so they may join us in death.
In the name of Nagash, all kingdoms must fall. There is no rest, no peace and no mercy.

Gunther Larenscheld has awoken one of Nagash's most loyal Lieutenants, the Dread King, in exchange for eternal life. Now he has received the promised reward - even in death, his spirit will not leave the mortal world.
Without the limitations of a body, Larenscheld is a much more competent fighter in death than he ever could be in life.
Larenscheld's ghost haunts the living, stalking the enemies soldiers.
Larenscheld specializes in killing the biggest enemies to extinguish their more potent life force in the name of Nagash.
Nagash allows Larenscheld's spirit to channel the winds of magic, enabling him to keep casting spells even in his ghost form.
Master of the dead in life, still master of the dead in death.
Larenscheld opens a portal through which vengeful spirits in the form of ethereal skulls appear. They are crashing down on the world of the living, causing widespread destruction.
All the difficulties to finally achieve immortality make Larenscheld cling to his unlife with an iron will forged by desperation and hardship.
Larenscheld may shed his mortal form at any time voluntarily to access his superior ghost form.
No longer just a mere apparition, Larenscheld's will remains after death - and becomes much more powerful.
Luthor is Larenscheld's faithful servant. He excels at ambushing, supporting his master to get rid of pesky adventurers and keeping his master safe from daggers in the dark.
The liche has discarded their life to achieve an existence as an immortal undead. As long as their will remains unbroken, they are almost impossible to destroy permanently.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Bone steeds pull dreaded chariots, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Elephants are unstoppable beasts, even more so when reanimated by dark magic.
Not all kings of Nehekara stand against Nagash. Some have been seduced by the power Nagash offers his loyal subjects.
Necromancers follow in the footsteps of Nagash, but none ever reached his mastery. For many, this pursuit ends in the service of Nagash and for the most talented few, in lichedom.
Through his disciples, Nagash increases his influence on the world of the living. And where Nagash has influence, the dead will not find any rest.
In life, he marched ahead as one of the generals of the Dread Legion and even in death the soldiers heed his commands.
Countless Legions lay beneath the sands, waiting for Nagash or his servants to call them back to battle the living.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The Pegasi were brought to Nehekhara from the Dread King's homelands. Now the reanimated bones still serve their Unliving masters.
